title.narrative: 2016 Management Project - Youth Segmentation Research Series

description.narrative: The project involves conducting a research study Exploring the Gendered Dimensions of Youth Livelihoods Programming, with a primary focus on sub-Saharan Africa. The overarching purpose of the study is: - To increase the overall understanding of gendered structural challenges faced by young men and women in developing the skills needed to enter the labour market or sustainable self-employment. - To provide specific insights for The MasterCard Foundation based on the review of its programme portfolio about how interventions to support access to sustainable jobs or entrepreneurship opportunities can be tailored to overcome the specific gendered challenges faced by young women and young men.
